titleStmt.title: The eagle and the body described in one sermon preached before Queene Elizabeth of precious memorie, in Lent. Anno 1601. By William Barlovv ...
titleStmt.author: Barlow, William, d. 1613.

editionStmt.edition: Newly called for, and set foorth.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed [by J. Windet] for Mathevv Lavv, and are to be sold at his shop in Pauls Church-yard, neere vnto Saint Austines Gate, at the signe of the Foxe,

notesStmt.note: Title page has a border of woodcut elements. Variant: title page in another setting, with a double rule border and "Elizabeth" misspelled "Elizaeth".
Identified as STC 1450a on UMI microfilm reel 575.
Reproductions of the originals in the Folger Shakespeare Library and the British Library.
Appears at reel 575 (Folger Shakespeare Library copy) and at reel 824 (British Library copy).

place.placeName: his shop in Pauls Church-yard, neere vnto Saint Austines Gate, at the signe of the Foxe
